ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_women] Diablo II
ygData.msgSnippet: I was staying with friends on the day Diablo II arrived at their house, and so we all took turns playing on their machines via TCP/IP.  It was a blast,
ygData.messageBody:
I was staying with friends on the day Diablo II arrived at their house, and so
we all took turns playing on their machines via TCP/IP. It was a blast,
although I found it two-dimensional at first, having become so accustomed to
agonizing over how to build my character ("Bam! You're a necro! That's
it!")--but in a way, it was a relief! Two choices, done!

I didn't get above level 6, but in the meantime, I had two pet skellies and a
golem, and boy lemme tell ya... such a difference, sitting back, filing my
nails, waving my wand airily to debuff the mobs... much different from the
ranger I normally play. <grin>

No one I have spoken to is fond of Open games, and I can see why not... haven't
tried a Realm game, but the TCP/IP is just as fun when you have a good group of
people.

Melissa Johnson wrote:

> I must agree, been playing it awhile and love it... have a 16 necro and a 18
> sorceress, necro is my favorite :-)
>
> The multiplayer isnt too bad... there are a few problems
>
> you can play on battlenet in 2 ways... Open games, and Realm games...
>
> Open games are played basically like Diablo 1 and open to all the cheating
> you can imagine.
>
> Realm games are on Battlenet servers, your charcter are stord on th server
> and games are ran on th server to prevent cheating. The problem with this
> though, they hav sub standard servers... and its basically impossible trying
> to play on servers designed for a few thousand people when 50,000 is trying
> to get on them... I only play the single player, and direct conecting
> TCP/IP with friends and forget the battlenet problems and cheaters
>
> but i startd playing this game over a week ago, nd hvent played EQ since...
> thats kinda hard after being addicted to EQ since beta
